Nottingham City Council has specific responsibilities towards people who might have support and care needs. 
Our offer is:
• We will do everything we can to help people live independently and where people do need support we will ensure it helps you live your life, meet your caring responsibilities and enables your independence.
•	If you come to us for help we will treat you as someone with unique talents and strengths, which we will help you to identify and use.

15 Carers across the Nottingham City and Nottinghamshire County are able to access a number of services to support them 
with their caring role. Available support may depend on whether the cared for is an adult or a child. All carers can access free information and advice and be referred and supported onwards as appropriate.
Other forms of support may include:
• Support groups for carers or to support them with the condition of the person they care for
• Access to health and leisure activities, sometimes at a reduced rate
• One to one support and guidance
• Access to activities for young carers
• A break from the caring role or respite care
• Direct payments for the carer to meet their assessed outcomes
We also work with a number of organisations and services to:
• Identify carers at an early stage in GP practices and schools
• Work with GP practices and schools to help them provide appropriate support once carers have been identiﬁ  ed

answer:
If your care needs have increased in Nottingham, you may be eligible for additional support from the council. **Contact the Nottingham City Health and Care Point at 0300 300 3333** to request a reassessment of your care needs. If eligible, a care plan will be created to provide the best possible support for you.

- **Eligibility and Assessment**: You will need to undergo a social care needs assessment to determine if you qualify for additional services. This assessment will consider your current difficulties and needs (Document 5).

- **Financial Support**: If eligible, you may receive a Personal Budget, which can be provided as Direct Payments. These payments allow you to arrange your own care services. You will undergo a financial assessment by the Fairer Charging Team to determine any personal contribution you might need to make (Documents 3 and 6).

- **Direct Payments**: If you opt for Direct Payments, you can manage your care services directly. However, you must ensure your personal contribution is paid into the Direct Payment account to avoid service disruptions (Document 6).

- **Practical Steps**: 
  - Call the Nottingham City Health and Care Point at 0300 300 3333 to initiate the reassessment process.
  - Visit the Nottingham City Council's website for more information on financial assessments and Direct Payments: [Nottingham City Council - Fairer Charging](http://www.nottinghamcity.gov.uk/fairercharging).

For further guidance, consider contacting the Money Advice Service at 0333 321 3434 for financial advice related to care services (Document 4).
